title: Interpreting r: Studying in College
question_text: A college professor examined the hours per week that a student studied and the number of tests that the student has failed in his college career. The regression equation is as follows: Tests failed = 15.6 − 0.802 × hours studied Tests failed = 15.6 − 0.802 × hours studied Predictor Coef SE Coef T P Constant 15.598 2.720 5.73 0.000 Hours Studied -0.8025 0.3767 -2.13 0.057 S = 6.29484 S = 6.29484 r 2 = 29.2 % r 2 = 29.2 % r 2 (adjusted) = 22.8 % r 2 (adjusted) = 22.8 % What is a valid interpretation of the correlation coefficient, r r ?
